name: Paradise Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel offers excellent value because of the wonderful staff, comfortable rooms, and its central location. We were pleased to find our room well-lit, unlike in so many other hotels. Somewhat inconvenient not having coffee or tea-making amenities in the room, but Reception was kind enough to give us hot water in a jug, or make us an Espresso for 1 Euro. Good breakfast. Wifi in room.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, and good value!

reviews.text: I stayed here overnight before an early-morning flight from Bologna. I wanted somewhere inexpensive and close to both the station and the old city, so I could walk from my train but also take a quick look around the city centre before flying home. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. My single room was pleasant and clean, and the staff were very warm and helpful both in the evening and when I had to check out at 4:30 am. I would have liked to stay longer!
reviews.title: Just what I needed for a quick solo stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Paradise for the last two nights of our two week trip to Italy. We searched hotels mostly through reviews on Trip Advisor and Venere, but were looking at price and location as the most important factors. This one hit both perfectly, walking distance to the central train station (which we walked to upon our departure), walking distance to the university, Due Torre, etc. Our room was simple and sparse but the A/C worked (it was so hot that week!), it was clean and safe, bathroom was small but functional (seems consistent with other hotels we stayed at) and the breakfast was nice but nothing phenomenal. We were especially pleased with the front desk staff (I'm sorry I don't know her name) but we came in via rental car and needed to drop it off - because the hotel is in the no car zone (ZTL I think) we were really concerned about getting a ticket - she gave us perfectly clear directions about how to get to Hertz. We also bought train tickets via the DB website and needed to print them out - no problem just email them to her and she printed them for us. Really nice and helpful! Bologna was an amazing surprise - we ended up here as an afterthought to the rest of our trip but would go back in a heartbeat. What a great town!
reviews.title: Fit our needs perfectly

reviews.text: I enjoyed the stay at Paradise hotel - very central, between Piazza Maggiore and Central station, and also to University area. Easy reach from/to airport, which we took airbus (BLQ, 6 euros every 15min) - get off / on at 'ARENA DEL SOLE' and hotel is 50 meters away.
reviews.title: Perfect stay in Bolgna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very helpful and friendly. In the room, there are mini bar, safe box as well. Also disposable tooth brush! Breakfast is more than adequate for Italian standard - ham, cheese, boiled egg, fruits, yoghurt, cereal, selection of bread and biscuit and cakes with all sorts of jam and pastes. The hotel has a cute touch, like riddle on the wall and all happy thoughts are everywhere, I really liked that. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent Small Centrally Located Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable hotel in a central location. The staff were friendly and luckily the air conditioner was very good as we stayed there during a heat wave.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: As a female traveler going around Europe alone, I tend to be rather careful about where I stay. I spent a few nights at this hotel last June and again chose to come this July. I can't beat the location and its price. It's 15 minutes tops from the train station on foot. The center of town is just a few minutes away and is easy to find from the hotel. Each time I stayed there the staff has been very, very friendly. The rooms I had were very clean and quite comfortable. They upgraded my room this time at no extra charge(!). The bathrooms have been impeccable both times. Also, breakfast is pretty good (and that's high praise). The only thing this time was that the air conditioner made a lot of noise until I figured out how to change its settings. But hey -- I was sooo thankful they had functioning A/C!
reviews.title: 2nd year in a row staying there

reviews.text: The ladies who run this lovely little hotel off one of the main streets in bologna are just fantastic. The studio apartment is quiet luxury with a lift and air con and lots of space. Little homely touches like plates of lollies and sweet sayings make it very welcoming and they are friendly and helpful. It is in a quiet street minutes from the main street and 10 minutes walk from the main square through lovely porticoes. Nice trattorias in the vicinity make this a great place to stay. Thank you for making us feel welcome in Bolgna
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel not far from centro bologna
A truly great little hotel with fabulous staff.
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay when visiting Bologna. For our 2 night stay we had a newly renovated apartment in a building across the road from the hotel. there was a tiny efficient lift and effective ac. The room was spotless and like being in a hotel suite with the staff ever helpful. Breakfast in the hotel section was lavish by comparison to some places which offer a much simpler choice. There was even provision for making toast. The hotel is in a great position as many reviewers have said. It was easy to walk everywhere and find great bars, cafes and restaurants. Thoroughly recommended.

Location was very central. The staff was fabulous and gave 5 star hotel concierge service. They made restaurant suggestions and reservations for us (recommendations were great!) and also tour reservations for us. Breakfast was generous and good. They were happy to make cappuccinos for you all day, past the breakfast time slot. The only difficulty is if you have a car. There is no parking for this hotel, and free street parking is impossible. The best bet though, is to park in the underground public parking lot nearby. The lot was close and easy to deal with and probably a lot safer than having your car on the street anyway.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Paradise is in an excellent location, just off Bologna's main thoroughfare, Via dell'Indipendenza and within easy walking distance of the Bologna Central trains station (15mins) and Piazza Maggiore (10mins). The vast majority of sights in Bologna are within easy walking distance, and there are myriad bars, cafes and restaurants in the surrounding streets.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted warmly by staff every time we met, whether it was on arrival or as we were leaving for the morning, and they were extremely friendly each time.
reviews.title: What a great hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large by continental standards, with a very comfortable bed, good air conditioning, good sized bathroom, safe and minibar. It was remarkably clean, obviously washed and laundered every day, and one of the cleanest places in which we've ever stayed.
reviews.title: Ideal Bologna Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast, included in the room rate, had a good selection of pastries, fruits, cereals, yoghurts, juices etc and set us up nicely for the day, and included a selection of gluten free products.
reviews.title: Well located and well run

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we were very impressed, feel we got good value for money and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. If there were a Hotel Paradise everywhere we went on holiday, we would gladly stay there.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Bologna!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights in May and really appreciated all the hotel had to offer. Good value, clean rooms, helpful staff, close to transportation and plenty of restaurants, shops, etc. We stayed in room 205, which is unfortunately situated over a very busy local cafe and often noisy street. This of course is NOT the hotels fault, but it definitely impacted our sleep because of the noise and fairly late hours of the cafe. I'm surprised this isn't mentioned in many other TA reviews. We loved everything about the hotel, but would recommend asking for a room away from the cafe side. .
reviews.title: Great little hotel, but the cafe next door can be a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel earlier this month (May 2012) and truly enjoyed it. Centrally located near Avenue Independenza. Rooms were not large but were comfortable. Nice breakfast area; the staff was most helpful in making dinner reservations, etc. Definitely would stay here again if we return to Bologna, which is a lovely city.
reviews.title: Great customer service and location

reviews.text: After being shell-shocked by prices in other parts of Italy, Paradise Hotel offered an excellent value for our family of four. We stayed in a studio apartment that perfectly met our needs and had the nicest of any bathroom we had during our ten days in Italy. Our only regret was only staying in Bologna for one night.
reviews.title: Amazing customer service and excellent value

reviews.text: Monica, one of the owners, helped us with any number of things and even gave us her parking spot by the hotel so that we could make an early getaway to the airport the next morning! The location was great -- just a 10-15 minute walk from Piazza Maggiore and just off Via dell'Indipendenza.
reviews.title: Hotel Paradise is a real paradise in the center of Bologna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was plentiful and a great way to start a long day of travel back to the United States.
reviews.title: A Great Home in Bologna

description: Hotel Paradise is more than a hotel: it’s our house, open with love to our guests. In our rooms you will always find our warmth and passion. A ball of wool yarn will welcome you and bring you back to us every time you may return to Bologna. Our stories too… will cradle you to a good nights’ sleep, and upon the following morning you will rise to find our good humor any assistance ready to please.
